channel.title: New site launched
channel.description:
Hi,
I just launched a website with a couple friends called sharetolearn. It's basically a collaboration of knowledge from people around the world about... well, anything. I'd like some feedback about the layout, colors, and general usability. Some of you might notice that the layout looks similar to fmylife.com, and you're right; I got the idea for the site while reading fmylife, but the entire site is coded from scratch by me and my friend.
http://www.sharetolearn.net

item.title: New site launched
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

no, Uriko’s idea is better: allow the user to select the opposite option later, and update accordingly… it was a bit of work, but the changes have been committed.

Read full topic

item.title: New site launched
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

well, at least remove the link that allows the others to still be click, but still indicate which has been clicked.

Read full topic

item.title: New site launched
item.dc:creator: @Uriko Uriko
item.description:
@Uriko wrote:

Why? Doesn’t that indicate what option they selected?

Read full topic

item.title: New site launched
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

It should grey out every option, not just the one they clicked.

Read full topic

item.title: New site launched
item.dc:creator: @Uriko Uriko
item.description:
@Uriko wrote:

Because you’re allowing them to click both, lol. It’s not really inefficient… I just don’t think it should be like that, I’m used to it being like urbandictionary.com And it’s not too much work at all.

Read full topic

item.title: New site launched
item.dc:creator: @Uriko Uriko
item.description:
@Uriko wrote:

[quote=“seand, post:9, topic:276003”]graying out their selection allows them to later see what they selected… and if we could’ve made it so that selecting the other one decrementing their previous selection and incremented their new selection, but that would have been too much work. much easier this way… i figure that most people won’t click both, because it only wastes their time[/quote]But it’s inefficient.

Read full topic

item.title: New site launched
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

graying out their selection allows them to later see what they selected… and if we could’ve made it so that selecting the other one decrementing their previous selection and incremented their new selection, but that would have been too much work. much easier this way… i figure that most people won’t click both, because it only wastes their time

Read full topic

item.title: New site launched
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

looks nice, but how come i can click both ‘already knew it’ and ‘didnt know it’, if you click one of them they should both be disabled

Read full topic

item.title: New site launched
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

i’m not sure what we use, my friend handles the whole software side of it… but we use the php function mysql_real_escape_string() to escape everything that goes into the DB, so unless there are bugs with that function, we shouldn’t have any sql injection problems

Read full topic

item.title: New site launched
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

Do you use MySQLI or PDO, or any sort of database driver that can prepare statements?
prepared statements u c, are win, since they’re less vulrenable to sql injects.

Read full topic

item.title: New site launched
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

oh, you mean by default? well, i kind of wanted to do it by latest submissions, so all posts get a more balanced number of views… if people want to view the most interesting, the link is right there

Read full topic

item.title: New site launched
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

the facts are ordered by post id, in reverse order, they should be ordered by how many people thought it was an interesting post.

Read full topic

item.title: New site launched
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

thanks for the heads-up on that, it’s been fixed (apparently my friend sucks at security). we’ve also noticed the XSS and sql attacks lately, and thanks for those too… i guess i should have realized if i posted on these forums they would be tested to the fullest extent for security… we tried to cover all those angles, but feel free to keep trying - and a small message of what you were able to exploit would be nice

oh, and @ eczema3: what do you mean order the posts by votes? we already do that with the links in the navbar (uncommon - most clicked ‘didn’t know it’, common - most clicked ‘already knew it’, etc.)

Read full topic

item.title: New site launched
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

javascript:give_feedback(‘numInteresting’, ‘31’, ‘4’);

change 31 to any number of any post you want and enter it into the address bar repeatedly and wahey! the votes go shooting up

EDIT: wait, forget that. Just open this webpage and mass refresh:
http://sharetolearn.net/give_feedback.php?feedbackType=numInteresting&id=31

ANOTHER EDIT: You should order your posts by votes on a certain topic, like how many people already new a subject, not by their id.

Read full topic
